_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Frontier Equity Exchange Association is an agricultural business that specializes in grain storage for area producers as well as providing the necessary inputs for grain production.  The company strives to maintain a safe and healthy work place.  Our farmer owners, managers and employees have made every effort to plan the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia.

The worst case scenario and alternate release scenarios have been elvaluated and shared with our local first responders as part of an on going training program.  More importantly, our employees have been trained in their respective emergency actions, including the emergency meeting place and each of their individual responsibilities regarding an acicdental release of anhydrous ammonia.

This company maintains and operates their NH3 plant in strict accordance with all Federal, State and Local authorities.  The Knasas Department of Agriculture inspect our plants on a regular basis and we comply with their requests for improvement.  Changes or improvements in the facilities equipment will be acted upon immediately following the enforcement agency (KDA) request, or as found to be necessary by our maintenance staff.

Our employees are trained in safety procedures, site specific operating procedures, proper plant maintenance and employees are competency tested over the training material.  Each employee uses goggles and gloves during ammonia transfer operations as well as always providing plenty of emergency safety water during nurse tank loading operations.

Witht the above mentioned training in mind, it makes it very simple to report that absolutely no injury accidents or property damage have occurred at this facility in the past five years.

Our emergency action plan is designed to minimize the risks to employees, the surrounding public and the area first responders.  The company provides plant tours for our local fire department and our plan has been shared with the county local emergency pla
nning commission (LEPC).  Each of our responding agencies is aware of the dangerous nature of anhydrous ammonia and they have agreed to assist us in the event of an emergency or accidental release.
